area_name: F: Shadow of a Man Area

content.description: Work your way up a tall slab that leads to a committing mantle up high.
content.location: Located to the right around the corner from Shadow of a Man. Start down low and to the left of the tree.

content.description: Start on two matched pockets and move up the slab on sparse holds and kind of bad feet. The topout is a little tough.
content.location: On the Shadow of a Man boulder, on the slab face that is between the Shadow of a Man arete and Seafoam Arete. It's near the middle of the face and starts on two matched pockets, to the right of Seams Easy V5.

content.description: Start on edges on the arete do a long reach, followed by another long reach up and left. Easy top out, but not a great fall if you blow it.
content.location: The arete left of KFC. On the boulder behind Shadow of a Man and Secret of Davenport.

content.description:
Start on Shadow of a Man, traverse left and finish on Secret of Davenport. I've heard that this is the same grade as Secret of Davenport, but I disagree. Plus it heads a few cool moves!  

  P.S. You can also try to do the sit start to Shadow of a Man, and then connect that into Shadow of Daventport. FA may still be up for grabs!?

climbs.name: Shadow of a Shadow of a Man

content.description: New ultra classic line of 2021 -- start on the footholds of the normal Shadow of a Man and go straight up. The crux is trying to pull on without dabbing on the damn ground. This is as low as it goes... May be impossible for those with wider frames as the space to pull on is quite narrow. And digging it out would just ruin the natural beauty of the line. This is NOT the same as Shadow of a Man Sit, which starts about 8ft to the right.
content.protection: Pad as for Shadow of a Man; I think 2-3 pads works well
content.location: This starts on the footholds of Shadow of a Man.

content.description: For the sit start, begin several feet to the right of the normal start for Shadow. Pull a large first move to some crimps, then traverse left into the start for Shadow of a Man.
content.location: A few feet to the right of the normal start of Shadow.

content.description: One of the best of the grade the Holies has to offer. Starting on a low jug, move up to a slopey sidepull, do some magic with your feet and reach your left hand up to a bad crimp. Get your feet up, and do a tricky move to a blocky jug in the middle of the face.
content.location: On the face of the Shadow of a Man boulder directly left of the right arete.

content.description: Start sitting quite low on the center of the Shadow of a Man face. Follow small crimps left and up slightly. Slap the lip and do a weird mantle about five feet above the ground. Not the best problem at the Holies, but cool holds. I climbed this thinking it was an FA and gave it this name. Dave Chancellor has since told me it has been done, but he says he cannot recall the name, so we will just go with this.
content.location: Shadow of a Man boulder, same face as the namesake problem

content.description: Follow the thin seam to the top-out. Crux is about mid-way up.
content.protection: A few well placed pads and active spotters should keep you safe.
content.location: This route is located on the same boulder as shadow of a man (around the corner to the right of it). Its on the South West facing side of the boulder approximately in the middle.

content.description: Named for the seafood green colored lichen on the boulder, this excellent sloping, vertical Crete doesn't receive the love and attention it deserves. A few perfect holds, couple good feet, and a committing move to a jug finish. Grad a couple pads and a trusted scooter, and you'll enjoy this unsung gem.
content.location: Walk around to the face opposite of Shadow of a Man on the Shadow of a Man boulder. It will be the arete on your left.

content.description: On the face opposite Shadow of a Man, start on the semi-circle crimps and move up to the small, crimpy seam. Make a long move right to the bread loaf. Stand up to the slopey rail and bump to the sloped side pull. Arete is off until the top out near Tennis Shoe Arete.A traverse is also possible all the way to KFC/Fat Lip.
content.location: The face opposite Shadow of a Man.

content.description: Move through good holds until you can get your right hand on the faint, slopey arete. Work your way through this cool feature to the easy top out. Short but sweet.
content.protection: 1 pad, spotter if you want it
content.location: Walking down the trail to Shadow of a Man, this relatively small boulder will be on your right. Worms Way will be to your left, Shadow of a Man just ahead. KFC climbs the trailside face.

content.description: A compression problem that goes up between Tennis Shoe Arete and KFC. Go to the pocket with your right, then climb up the two arete features.
content.location: Between Tennis Shoe Arete and KFC.

content.description: Begin on the Shadow of a Man sit start, several feet to the right of the normal start for Shadow. Pull a large first move to some crimps, then traverse left into the start for Shadow of a Man. From there, traverse into and finish on Secret of Davenport. Adds a few moves to Shadow of Davenport. Not too much harder than Secret/Shadow of Davenport.
content.location: A few feet to the right of the normal start of Shadow of a Man; same start as Shadow of a Man Sit

content.description: Start standing on slopers, follow the slopey lip about halfway across the entire face and then mantle. Poor feet.
content.location: Facing Seafoam Arete and Comfortably Numb, it traverses the swooping lip of the boulder starting on the right side.

content.description: Follow a line of small, sharp crimps up the slabby face. Could have more stars if the holds felt a bit better to hold...
content.location: Facing Seafoam Arete, it is the problem that ascends straight up the face.

pathTokens: F: Shadow of a Man Area

content.description: The Shadow of a Man boulder and the surrounding area is home to a ton of problems ranging from very easy to very hard.
